https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/aiHFEnEcQ9MFpuvvj8d8tvS5pWN.jpg The film I made from Gary Henoch and Harlow Robinsonâ€™s footage, An Anagram is not a documentary at all, but rather a poetic essay on the impact of the sudden collapse of a belief system on a culture. It has a 17 part quasi-musical structure inspired by Dmitri Shostakovich's Preludes and Fugues that at times ignores the literal meaning of certain interviews for the fragrant affect of the language and body language; that is, certain interactions are left un-translated so that the viewer is given full and unfettered access to the musical spirit that animates the arguments and quarrels caught so delicately in the sound and images. - Daniel Barnett An Anagram
